English:
Welcome to Tower Records! Please come in! Our
motto is "No Music, No Life!" Here you can find
music from all over the world!
Chinese:
歡迎光臨淘兒唱片！
No Music No Life！
本店備有豐富的世界各地音樂！
EnglishCensored:
Welcome to Shibuya Records! Please come in!
Here you can find music from all over the world!
Korean:
환영합니다! 타워레코드에 어서오세요!
NO 뮤직 NO 라이프!
저희 가게는 전세계의 음악을 풍부하게 갖추고 있습니다♪
German:
Willkommen bei Shibuya Records! Hereinspaziert!
Hier findet man Musik aus der ganzen Welt!

English:
Wha!? That's so weird! I would have thought
everything here would be in alphabetical order,
but it looks like everything is all mixed up...
Chinese:
咦～真奇怪，
照五十音順序的話應該是在這附近才對啊……
總覺得排列順序好像變了……
Korean:
어라~ 이상하네에
오십음도로 따지면 이 부근에 있을 텐데…
왜인지 미묘하게 진열 순서가 바뀐 느낌이 들어
German:
Was?! Wie seltsam! Ich dachte, hier wäre alles in
alphabetischer Reihenfolge, aber anscheinend
ist alles durcheinander ...

English:
Recently, I happened to pick up a CD and look at
it. It looked homemade... Seems like someone's
going around mixing homemade CDs with the others.
Chinese:
前陣子隨手拿起一張CD，
沒想到居然像是自己手工做的CD……
難道有人把手工CD偷塞進來嗎？
Korean:
요전에 생각 없이 CD를 손에 들었더니
손수 만든 거라고 생각되는 CD가 나왔어요…
혹시 수제 CD를 상품에 섞어 놓는 패거리가 있는 걸까요
German:
Vorhin habe ich mir eine CD angesehen, die war
wohl selbstgemacht ... Es geht wohl jemand rum
und mischt seine eigenen CDs unter die anderen.

English:
Maybe there was a witness in the shop.
Would you mind asking around for information?
If you find anything just give me a shout!
Chinese:
店內說不定有目擊人士。
這種時候就是要先從打聽開始吧，嗯！
有什麼事的話，請再來跟我說！
Korean:
혹시 점내에 목격자가 있을 지도 몰라요
우선 이런 건 탐문부터 해보는 거 아닐까요, 응!
또 뭔가 있다면 말을 걸어 주세요!
German:
Vielleicht hat es jemand im Laden beobachtet.
Könntest du bitte rumfragen? Wenn du
etwas findest, sag Bescheid!

English:
Whoever it is must be creeping in at night and
shuffling their own CDs in. If you want to find
out who did it, you'd best come at night.
Chinese:
既然可以移動店內陳列放這種CD上去，
表示犯人應該是趁夜裡偷偷摸進來的。
要找犯人的話，晚上再過來比較好吧？
Korean:
점내의 진열을 바꾸고 이런 CD를 놓아둔 거니까
밤마다 가게에 숨어들은 거겠네
범인을 찾고 있다면 밤에 와보는 게 좋지 않아?
German:
Wer auch immer es ist, schleicht sich bestimmt
nachts rein und mischt seine CDs unter. Den Täter
erwischst du, wenn du nachts herkommst.

English:
Reiko has made a corner just for Etemon's CDs.
You should definitely go and check it out
when you have the time.
Chinese:
田和玲子說已經
設置了悟空獸的CD專區……
既然她都這樣說了，有空的時候去看看吧。
Korean:
타와 레이코가
에테몬의 CD 코너를 만들었다고 했었지…
모처럼이니 시간이 있을 때 가보도록 해라
German:
Reiko hat eine Ecke nur für Etemons CDs
eingerichtet. Du musst sie dir unbedingt ansehen,
wenn du Zeit hast.

English:
Wait, Detective!
Where are you going?
Chinese:
等等，偵探大人！
你要去哪裡？
Korean:
잠깐, 탐정님!
어디 가는 건가요?
German:
Einen Moment, Detektiv!
Wo gehst du hin?

English: I can't go back...
Chinese: 好像回不去……
Korean: 돌아갈 수 없는 것 같다…
German: Ich kann nicht zurück ...

English: Anyway, back to Reiko...
Chinese: 總之先回去田和玲子那邊吧。
Korean: 아무튼 타와 레이코 씨에게 돌아가자
German: Also, wieder zu Reiko ...

English: Hey!!!
Chinese: 啵啵～
Korean: 메롱~~
German: He!

English:
Looks like Etemon has run off in a different
direction...
Chinese: 悟空獸似乎逃往別的方向了……
Korean: 에테몬은 다른 방향으로 도망친 듯하다…
German:
Etemon scheint in eine andere Richtung
davongelaufen zu sein ...

English:
Tower Records is great at night. I wanted to play
something with a nighttime feel to it...
Oh, we should probably be quiet though, right?
Chinese:
夜晚的淘兒唱片也不錯呢～
讓我突然好想放些適合夜晚的音樂……
啊！　安靜一點比較好對吧……
EnglishCensored:
Shibuya Records is great at night. I wanted to play
something with a nighttime feel to it...
Oh, we should probably be quiet though, right?
Korean:
밤의 타워레코드도 좋네요~
뭔가 밤에 어울리는 음악을 틀고 싶어져요…
앗, 조용히 하는 게 좋겠죠…
German:
Shibuya Records ist nachts super. Ich wollte etwas
spielen, das einen nächtlichen Vibe hat ...
Ach, wir sollten leise sein, oder?

English: Huh? Oh, welcome!
Chinese: 吱吱！歡迎光臨♪
Korean: 우캬, 여기 어서오세~요♪
German: Was? Oh, willkommen!

English: Okay then, go ahead, just try to catch me!
Chinese: 來啊～來抓我呀！
Korean: 자~아, 날 잡아 보~라구!
German: Na los! Versucht doch, mich zu fangen!

English: Over here! This way! Ooohooh ahhhahhh!
Chinese: 來啊來啊，我在這裡喔♪吱吱吱！
Korean: 자아 자, 이쪽이야~앗♪ 웃킷키이!
German: Hier drüben! Hier lang! Ooohooh ahhhahhh!

English: Ooohooh ahhahh! This way, this way!
Chinese: 吱吱！在這裡、在這裡！
Korean: 우캬캬! 이쪽이야 이쪽!
German: Ooohooh ahhahh! Hier drüüüben!

English: We're never gonna catch him like this!
Chinese: 這、這樣下去沒完沒了……！
Korean: 이, 이대로는 끝이 안 나겠어…!
German: So kriegen wir ihn nie!

English:
We might be able to catch him if we cut in around
from behind... Do you have any suggestions?
Chinese:
如果可以繞到它後面的話，或許就抓得到它了……
有沒有什麼好方法呢？
Korean:
뒤로 돌아갈 수 있다면 붙잡을 수 있을지도…
뭔가 방법이 없을까?
German:
Wir könnten ihn kriegen, wenn wir ihm von hinten
den Weg abschneiden ... Hast du Ideen?

English:
We should be able to get behind that Digimon from
here...
Chinese:
從這裡應該可以
正好繞到那隻數碼寶貝的背後……
Korean:
여기에서라면 딱 저 디지몬의 등뒤로
나갈 수 있을 터…
German: Von hier aus sollten wir das Digimon erwischen ...

English:
I can feel some sort of "connection" to
somewhere...! Somewhere near here there's a place
you can Connect Jump from... Let's look for it!
Chinese:
感覺這裡正與某處「連結」……！
附近或許有「可以登入跳躍的場所」……
找找看吧！
Korean:
어딘가「이어져 있는」게 느껴져…!
가까이에「커넥트 점프 가능한 장소」가 있는 걸지도 모른다
찾아보자!
German:
Ich fühle hier eine Verbindung, einen „Link“ ...
Irgendwo ist hier ein Ort, von wo man einen
Verbindungssprung benutzen kann. Suchen wir ihn!

English:
Huh!? I heard that! I heard! Someone is
approaching!?
Chinese:
嗯～！？　我聽到了，我都聽到囉～！！
有人正在接近我對不對～！？
Korean:
음~!? 들려, 들린다구~!!
누군가 나한테 가까이 오고 있네~!?
German: Was?! Das habe ich gehört! Jemand nähert sich?!

English:
I have trained my demonic ear to pick up even the
weakest notes. I can hear everything you say!
Chinese:
最好不要小看我這雙
將全部資料奉獻給音樂的順風耳！
Korean:
음악에 모든 데이터를 바친 내 지옥귀를
얕보지 말아줬~으면 하~는데!!
German:
Ich habe mein dämonisches Ohr darauf trainiert,
auch die leisesten Noten zu hören. Ich höre jedes
Wort!

English:
Even from my hiding place I can hear your
footsteps clear as day!!! Oowaah!!
Chinese:
就算你藏起來了，
我還是可以清楚聽到你的腳步聲！！吱吱！
Korean:
모습을 숨겨도 네 발소리가
확―실히 들리니까 말얏!! 웃캬아!!
German:
Selbst von meinem Versteck aus kann ich eure
Schritte laut und deutlich hören! Jawohl, ja!
